title_sort: walt whitman to ulysses s. grant, 27 february 1874
title: Walt Whitman to Ulysses S. Grant, 27 February 1874
text: 431 Stevens st. Cor West.Camden, N. Jersey.Feb.February 27. '74Dear Mr. President,Hoping, (should time & inclination favor,) to give you a moment's diversion from the weight of official & political cares—& thinking, of all men, you can return to those scenes, in the vein I have written about them—I take the liberty of sending, (same mail with this) some reminiscences I have printed about the war, in nos.numbers of the N. Y. Weekly Graphic.I am not sure you will remember me, or my occasional salute to you, in Washington. I am laid up here with tedious paralysis,—but think I shall get well & return to Washington.Very respectfullyWalt Whitman Walt Whitman to Ulysses S. Grant, 27 February 1874
